Warren P. Lombard pamphlets and reprints
1885-1926

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was accumulated from different sources.

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Warren P. Lombard pamphlets and reprints, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Warren P. Lombard was a professor of physiology at the University of Michigan.

scopecontent.p: This collection of pamphlets and reprints of writings of Warren P. Lombard was accumulated from various sources. The collection has been arranged alphabetically by title.

did.unittitle: Pamphlets and Reprints
Alterations in the strength which occur during fatiguing voluntary muscular work. 1893
The blood pressure in the arterioles, capillaries, and small veins of the human skin. 1912
Der Blutdruck in den Kapillaren und kleinen Venen der menschlichen Haut. 1911
Draft of plan to make it easier for medical practitioners to enlist in the army or navy. 1917
The duration of the systole of the left ventricle of man. 1926
The effect of fatigue on voluntary muscular contractions. 1890
Effect of position of body on the length of systole and diastole and rate of pulse in man. 1919
Effect of posture on the length of the systole of the human heart. 1919
Effect of pulse rate on the length of the systoles and diastoles of the normal human heart in the standing position. 1919
Effet de la fatigue sur la contraction muscular volontaire. 1890
"Greetings from universities and colleges of the Middle West" in The centennial of Hobart College, 1822-1922. 1922
Henry Sewall and the department of physiology. 1909
Is the "Knee-kick" a reflex act? 1887
The life and work of Carl Ludwig. 1916
The mechanical effects produced by the contraction of individual muscles of the thigh of the frog. 1907
A method of recording changes in body weight which occur within short intervals of time. 1906
A new form of piston recorder and some of the changes of the volume of the finger which it records. 1899
On the nature of the knee-jerk. undated
Die raumliche und zeitliche aufeinanderfolge reflectorisch contrahirter muskeln. 1885
Re-enforcement and inhibition of nervous processes. 1901
A review of the life of Ludwig. 1905
Secondary rhythms of the normal heart. 1899
Some of the influences which affect the power of voluntary muscular contractions. 1892
The tendon action and leverage of two-joint muscles of the hind leg of the frog with special reference to the spring movement. 1903
The variations of the normal knee-jerk. 1887
